abstract.description: an abstract class is a high level class or slot that is typically used to group common slots together and cannot be directly instantiated.

alias.description: the name used for a slot in the context of its owning class.  If present, this is used instead of the actual slot name.

apply_to.description: Used to extend class or slot definitions. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

base.description: python base type that implements this type definition

class_uri.description: URI of the class in an RDF environment

comments.description: notes and comments about an element intended for external consumption

default_curi_maps.description: ordered list of prefixcommon biocontexts to be fetched to resolve id_prefixes and inline prefix variables

default_prefix.description: default and base prefix -- used for ':' identifiers, @base and @vocab

default_range.description: default slot range to be used if range element is omitted from a slot definition

defining_slots.description: The combination of is_a plus defining slots form a genus-differentia definition, or the set of necessary and sufficient conditions that can be transformed into an OWL equivalence axiom

deprecated.description: Description of why and when this element will no longer be used

description.description: a description of the element's purpose and use

domain.description:
defines the type of the subject of the slot.  Given the following slot definition
  S1:
    domain: C1
    range:  C2
the declaration
  X:
    S1: Y

implicitly asserts that X is an instance of C1

from_schema.description: id of the schema that defined the element

generation_date.description: date and time that the schema was loaded/generated

id_prefixes.description: a list of Curie prefixes that are used in the representation of instances of the model.  All prefixes in this list are added to the prefix sections of the target models.

identifier.description: True means that this slot must be unique across the collection of slots

ifabsent.description: description of special behavior if the slot is absent

imports.description: other schemas that are included in this schema

in_subset.description: used to indicate membership of a term in a defined subset of biolink terms used for a particular domain or application (e.g. the translator_minimal subset holding the minimal set of predicates used in a translator knowledge graph)

inherited.description: true means that the *value* of a slot is inherited by subclasses

inlined.description: an inlined definition a list of actual values rather than references.  Only applies to slots whose range is a class.

inverse.description: used to indicate the inverse of a slot (e.g. 'expresses' is the inverse predicate of 'expressed in')

is_a.description: specifies single-inheritance between classes or slots. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is_a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded

key.description: true means that the slot uniquely identifies the element within the context of its container

local_name.description: the nsname (sans ':' for a given prefix)

local_names.description: map from local identifier to slot

metamodel_version.description: Version of the metamodel used to load the schema

mixin.description: this slot or class can only be used as a mixin -- equivalent to abstract

mixins.description: List of definitions to be mixed in. Targets may be any definition of the same type

multivalued.description: true means that slot can have more than one value

name.description: the unique name of the element within the context of the schema

notes.description: editorial notes about an element intended for internal consumption

prefix_uri.description: A URI associated with a given prefix

prefixes.description: prefix / URI definitions to be added to the context beyond those fetched from prefixcommons in id_prefixes

range.description:
defines the type of the object of the slot.  Given the following slot definition
  S1:
    domain: C1
    range:  C2
the declaration
  X:
    S1: Y

implicitly asserts Y is an instance of C2

readonly.description: If present, slot is read only.  Text explains why

required.description: true means that the slot must be present in the loaded definition

slot_uri.description: predicate of this slot for semantic web application

slot_usage.description: the redefinition of a slot in the context of the containing class definition.

slots.description: list of slot names that are applicable to a class

source_file.description: name, uri or description of the source of the schema

source_file_date.description: modification date of the source of the schema

source_file_size.description: size in bytes of the source of the schema

subclass_of.description: instances of this class are considered/required to be sub classes of the target URI

subsets.description: list of subsets referenced in this model

title.description: the official title of the schema

types.description: data types used in the model

values_from.description: identifies the possible uri's of the range

ClassDefinition.description: the definition of a class or interface

apply_to.description: Used to extend class or slot definitions. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

class_uri.description: URI of the class in an RDF environment

defining_slots.description: The combination of is_a plus defining slots form a genus-differentia definition, or the set of necessary and sufficient conditions that can be transformed into an OWL equivalence axiom

is_a.description: specifies single-inheritance between classes or slots. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is_a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded

mixins.description: List of definitions to be mixed in. Targets may be any definition of the same type

slot_usage.description: the redefinition of a slot in the context of the containing class definition.

slots.description: list of slot names that are applicable to a class

subclass_of.description: instances of this class are considered/required to be sub classes of the target URI

local_name.description: the nsname (sans ':' for a given prefix)

prefix_uri.description: A URI associated with a given prefix

SchemaDefinition.description: a collection of subset, type, slot and class definitions

default_curi_maps.description: ordered list of prefixcommon biocontexts to be fetched to resolve id_prefixes and inline prefix variables

default_prefix.description: default and base prefix -- used for ':' identifiers, @base and @vocab

default_range.description: default slot range to be used if range element is omitted from a slot definition

description.description: a description of the element's purpose and use

generation_date.description: date and time that the schema was loaded/generated

imports.description: other schemas that are included in this schema

metamodel_version.description: Version of the metamodel used to load the schema

prefixes.description: prefix / URI definitions to be added to the context beyond those fetched from prefixcommons in id_prefixes

source_file.description: name, uri or description of the source of the schema

source_file_date.description: modification date of the source of the schema

source_file_size.description: size in bytes of the source of the schema

subsets.description: list of subsets referenced in this model

title.description: the official title of the schema

types.description: data types used in the model

SlotDefinition.description: the definition of a property or a slot

The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

uri.description: the URI to be used for the type in semantic web mappings
